messages.content: Is cooling RAM or and SSD a waste of power?
No, cooling RAM or an SSD is not a waste of power. Cooling these components helps them to operate at more consistent temperatures, which can improve their performance and lifespan.
Would there be any performance gains?

Yes, cooling RAM or an SSD can lead to performance gains. Lower temperatures can reduce the amount of wear and tear on the components, which can result in improved performance. Additionally, higher temperatures can lead to slower performance, so cooling these components can help to ensure that your computer runs at its best.
Are ryzen processors more power efficient than intel ones? They have a smaller semiconductor size.

Yes, Ryzen processors are typically more power efficient than Intel ones due to their smaller semiconductor size. They are able to operate at lower temperatures and with less power, which can lead to improved performance and lower energy costs. Additionally, Ryzen processors are designed to be more power-efficient than their Intel counterparts, which can result in better performance and lower energy costs.
